instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.D7701: What is D7701? diode in the backlight circuit sitting between the BKL_SW pin of the LED driver and backlight output. Very common for via between this and BKL_FB for feedback to blow, causing no boost. Measure continuity between pin 2 of this diode and feedback pin of LED driver if backlight output is PPBUS_G3H with no boost.
definitions.LP8550: What is LP8550? This is an LED driver responsible for creating the backlight on the LCD screen of Macbooks from 2011 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight, just image
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  with no backlight, just image. Corrosion around <CHIP>U7701</CHIP>. 

Interestingly im getting 8V on <SIGNAL>PPVOUT_SW_LCDBKLT_FB</SIGNAL>

I've reflowed <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> still the same. 

I'm wondering If i should just replace the chip?

However, I can only find the 15BA D68B version of this chip. and the one on the board is 5409 d68b

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight, just image
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7701</CHIP> is very sensitive to corrosion.
Always need to change it in such case.
Also check its continuity to L/<DIODE>D7701</DIODE>, especially XW7720 bridge.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight, just image
threads.message: awesome, would 15BA D68B be compatible? it's still <CHIP>LP8550</CHIP>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight, just image
threads.message:
It should work.
I never checked the body marking...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight, just image
threads.message: awesome will wait for that in the post and i'll get back! thank you!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no backlight, just image
threads.message: <CHIP>U7701</CHIP> did the trick! thank you very much!!!
